alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 30 at 2:48PM MDT until March 30 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM TODAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK AND ALL OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT NOON TO 8 PM FRIDAY FOR THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, AND THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Widespread critical fire weather conditions continue today across much of central and eastern New Mexico below snowpack. Very strong southwest winds, low relative humidity values, near to above normal temperatures, and a high Haines index are occurring. Relative humidity values have drop into the single digits for several hours this afternoon across eastern New Mexico. Critical fire weather conditions return Friday across the central highlands and eastern plains though temperatures will not be as high. Nonetheless, very strong westerly winds and low humidity values are expected. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), and the Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124) through this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts between 55 and 65 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values ranging between 8 and 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
